Industry           Available Technologies    Technology Portfolio    NDAs    MTAs & SRAs    DEEP™ Ready-to-sign License    Licensing FAQs         Innovation Toolkit           Innovation Handbooks    Innovation Ecosystem    Awards & Funding Opportunities    Education Series         About           Impact Report FY 2019    Contact Us    Staff    Student Development    News    Events    General FAQs          Eyebrow menu    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Office of Technology Management    Industry    MTAs & SRAs        MTAs & SRAs  All MTA and SRA services with the University are handled by UIC’s Office of Research Services (ORS), under the Office of the Vice Chancellor for Research (OVCR).  Material Transfer Agreements (MTA) refer to an agreement in which a University lab either sends or receives tangible research materials to another lab or entity.   Tangible research materials include, but are not limited to:  plasmids, antibodies, cell stocks, cultures, animal models, prototypes, chemical compounds, and equipment.   For more information about initiating an MTA, contact the Office of Research Services here:   Material Transfer Agreements   Sponsored Research Agreements (SRA) refer to an agreement between UIC researchers and an outside entity which is offering to fund research towards a specific goal.  Any proposal must be routed through the Office of Research Services.  More information may be found under the Sponsored Programs section of the OVCR website here:   Preparing a Proposal        Call to Action             Submit Your Idea!
